intro: Anil madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant produces a bulbous root system and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid climate. Anil madagascariensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
